item.title: Drop curb needed, 10th June
item.description:

item.title: Could somebody from hackney council please invest some money or plant some bushes or nice trees at this location outside the Trowbridge GP surgery. It will make a difference to residents and bring a smile to patience face special day when you get bad news. If you compare how Inglesham Walk is being maintained to this area it is very run down. Inglesham Walk is looking very lovely and blossoming., 10th June
item.description:

item.title: Trees and hanging baskets along the high street require watering, 10th June
item.description:
Some of the trees and hanging baskets along the high street, particularly outside the tattoo parlour (approximately opposite the old Picturehouse Cinema) are in desperate need of water. Please can you arrange for this before the trees and flowers die - particularly with the very warm weather expected later this week. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Warren Walk need sweeping, 10th June
item.description:
Warren Walk hasnt been swept for a long time, it is covered with weeds, there are also lots of old TVs , road signs and general rubbish in the wooded area next to warren walk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coombe Lodge, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men dropping litter, 10th June
item.description:
I noticed that as the bin men were tipping the bins into the back of the bin lorry a lot of rubbish dropped on the floor, I asked if he was going to pick that up , he said that was the street sweepers job and moved on,,the pile of litter was blowing around in the wind, I went and asked the driver if they were going to pick up the litter they had just dropped and he instructed the bin men to go and pick up what they had just dropped and they went and picked up about half of it and moved on,,I picked up the rest .. I kept an eye on them and they did the same at the next lot of bins,,dropped a load of rubbish as they were tipping the bins into the lorry, one guy had a load of rubbish around his feet that he had just dropped and instead of picking it up he kicked it out the way,when I asked if they were going to pick that up one of the guys got quite rude with me

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
